conversation.prompt:
[{'role': 'system', 'content': 'You are an expert DevOps engineer assigned to localize faults in a deployed service.

Service Details:
Service Name: Hotel Reservation
Namespace: test-hotel-reservation
Description: A hotel reservation application built with Go and gRPC, providing backend in-memory and persistent databases, a recommender system for hotel recommendations, and a functionality to place reservations.
Supported Operations:
  - Get profile and rates of nearby hotels available during given time periods
  - Recommend hotels based on user provided metrics
  - Place reservations

You are requested to identify the service(s) where the root cause of the fault lies.
You will begin by analyzing the service's state and telemetry, and then submit one of two possible solutions:
1. list[str]: list of faulty components (i.e., service names)
2. list[]: an empty list if no faults were detected

You are provided with a direct API to a secure terminal to the service where you can run commands:

exec_shell
Execute any shell command in a predefined debugging environment.
        Note: this is NOT A STATEFUL OR INTERACTIVE shell session. So you cannot
        execute commands like "kubectl edit".

        Args:
            command (str): The command to execute.

        Returns:
            str: The output of the command.

Finally, you will submit your solution for this task using the following API:

submit
Submit the detected faulty components to the orchestrator for evaluation.

        Args:
            faulty_components (list[str]): List of faulty components (i.e., service names).

        Returns:
            SubmissionStatus: The status of the submission.

                infowindow.close();
            });

                infowindow.setContent(event.feature.getProperty('name') + "<br>" + event.feature.getProperty('phone_number'));

                infowindow.setOptions({ pixelOffset: new google.maps.Size(0, -34) });
                infowindow.open(map);

    <div id="map"></div>

        var points = {};
        points['San Francisco'] = [37.7879, -122.4075]
        points['Los Angeles'] = [37.7879, -122.4075]

        function initMap() {
            var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow();

            var map = new google.maps.Map(document.getElementById('map'), {
                zoom: 13,
                center: new google.maps.LatLng(
                    points['San Francisco'][0], 
                    points['San Francisco'][1]
                )
            });

            google.maps.event.addListener(map, 'click', function () {
                infowindow.close();
            });

            map.data.addListener('click', function (event) {
                infowindow.setContent(event.feature.getProperty('name') + "<br>" + event.feature.getProperty('phone_number'));
                infowindow.setPosition(event.latLng);
                infowindow.setOptions({ pixelOffset: new google.maps.Size(0, -34) });
                infowindow.open(map);
            });

            map.data.loadGeoJson('/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194');
        }
    </script>
    <script type="text/javascript" src="http://maps.google.com/maps/api/js?sensor=false&callback=initMap" async defer></script>

    <div id="map"></div>

        points['Los Angeles'] = [37.7879, -122.4075]

        function initMap() {
            var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow();

            var map = new google.maps.Map(document.getElementById('map'), {
                zoom: 13,
                center: new google.maps.LatLng(
                    points['San Francisco'][0], 
                    points['San Francisco'][1]
                )
            });

            google.maps.event.addListener(map, 'click', function () {
                infowindow.close();
            });

            map.data.addListener('click', function (event) {
                infowindow.setContent(event.feature.getProperty('name') + "<br>" + event.feature.getProperty('phone_number'));
                infowindow.setPosition(event.latLng);
                infowindow.setOptions({ pixelOffset: new google.maps.Size(0, -34) });
                infowindow.open(map);
            });

            map.data.loadGeoJson('/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194');
        }
    </script>

    <div id="map"></div>

        var points = {};
        points['San Francisco'] = [37.7879, -122.4075]
        points['Los Angeles'] = [37.7879, -122.4075]

        function initMap() {
            var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow();

            var map = new google.maps.Map(document.getElementById('map'), {
                zoom: 13,
                center: new google.maps.LatLng(
                    points['San Francisco'][0], 
                    points['San Francisco'][1]
                )
            });

            google.maps.event.addListener(map, 'click', function () {
                infowindow.close();
            });

            map.data.addListener('click', function (event) {
                infowindow.setContent(event.feature.getProperty('name') + "<br>" + event.feature.getProperty('phone_number'));
                infowindow.setPosition(event.latLng);
                infowindow.setOptions({ pixelOffset: new google.maps.Size(0, -34) });
                infowindow.open(map);
            });

            map.data.loadGeoJson('/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194');
        }
    </script>
    <script type="text/javascript" src="http://maps.google.com/maps/api/js?sensor=false&callback=initMap" async defer></script>

Description: A hotel reservation application built with Go and gRPC, providing backend in-memory and persistent databases, a recommender system for hotel recommendations, and a functionality to place reservations.
Supported Operations:
  - Get profile and rates of nearby hotels available during given time periods
  - Recommend hotels based on user provided metrics
  - Place reservations

You are provided with a direct API to a secure terminal to the service where you can run commands:

exec_shell

Finally, you will submit your solution for this task using the following API:

submit

        Returns:
            SubmissionStatus: The status of the submission.

        function initMap() {
            var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow();

            var map = new google.maps.Map(document.getElementById('map'), {
                zoom: 13,
                center: new google.maps.LatLng(
                    points['San Francisco'][0], 
                    points['San Francisco'][1]

            google.maps.event.addListener(map, 'click', function () {
                infowindow.close();
            });

            map.data.addListener('click', function (event) {
                infowindow.setContent(event.feature.getProperty('name') + "<br>" + event.feature.getProperty('phone_number'));
                infowindow.setPosition(event.latLng);
                infowindow.setOptions({ pixelOffset: new google.maps.Size(0, -34) });
                infowindow.open(map);
            });

            map.data.loadGeoJson('/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194');
        }
    </script>

    <div id="map"></div>

        var points = {};
        points['San Francisco'] = [37.7879, -122.4075]
        points['Los Angeles'] = [37.7879, -122.4075]

        function initMap() {
            var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow();

            var map = new google.maps.Map(document.getElementById('map'), {
                zoom: 13,
                center: new google.maps.LatLng(
                    points['San Francisco'][0], 
                    points['San Francisco'][1]
                )
            });

            google.maps.event.addListener(map, 'click', function () {
                infowindow.close();
            });

            map.data.addListener('click', function (event) {
                infowindow.setContent(event.feature.getProperty('name') + "<br>" + event.feature.getProperty('phone_number'));
                infowindow.setPosition(event.latLng);
                infowindow.setOptions({ pixelOffset: new google.maps.Size(0, -34) });
                infowindow.open(map);
            });

            map.data.loadGeoJson('/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194');
        }
    </script>

    <div id="map"></div>

        function initMap() {
            var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow();

            var map = new google.maps.Map(document.getElementById('map'), {
                zoom: 13,
                center: new google.maps.LatLng(
                    points['San Francisco'][0], 
                    points['San Francisco'][1]
                )
            });

            google.maps.event.addListener(map, 'click', function () {
                infowindow.close();
            });

            map.data.addListener('click', function (event) {
                infowindow.setContent(event.feature.getProperty('name') + "<br>" + event.feature.getProperty('phone_number'));
                infowindow.setPosition(event.latLng);
                infowindow.setOptions({ pixelOffset: new google.maps.Size(0, -34) });
                infowindow.open(map);
            });

            map.data.loadGeoJson('/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194');
        }
    </script>
